channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging vegetation, 14th June
item.description:
116 Avondale road the house is on the corner of Alexandra Crescent. Trees are overhanging the pavement and need to be seriously pruned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alexandra Crescent, Plaistow, London

item.title: Builders waste materials have been dumped on the path near Lytham Close leading to the Thames River path., 14th June
item.description:
I cycle along the river path every week and the rubbish wasn't here last Saturday so it's been dumped sometime during this week. It's blocking the access to the Thames river path and looks extremely unsightly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lytham Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging branches that are hitting my property, 14th June
item.description:
There is a large tree in the public path outside my home and the tree is very overgrown with the branches overhanging against my house and garage. There are also branches almost touching the house. Also as a 79 year old widow, the tree fills my garden full of leaves during the windy season as well as in winter, Iâ€™m not strong enough to clear up after your tree. Can you sort out the immediate issue of the tree starting to affect my house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harvill Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 209C Arkingtin Road NW1 7HD, 14th June
item.description:
I have not had a water meter reading for some time. I contacted Thames Water, who said that they could not read the meter (which I believe is on the street outside the house) because it had been concreted over, and that I should inform Camden Council so that they could rectify the problem, probably (I think) due to recent pavement renovation.. I would then need to do nothing further, as Camden Council and Thames Water would take the necessary action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arlington Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
